info.name: Shopify REST Admin API
info.description:
# Shopify REST Admin API

REST API endpoints for Shopify Admin API operations.

## Quick Start

### 1. Set Environment Variables

| Variable | Required | Description |
|----------|----------|-------------|
| `shopify_store` | ✅ | Store name (e.g., `my-store` for my-store.myshopify.com) |
| `shopify_token` | ✅ | Admin API access token (`shpat_...`) |
| `shopify_api_version` | ✅ | API version (default: `2025-01`) |

### 2. Get Your Access Token

1. Go to your Shopify Admin → Settings → Apps and sales channels
2. Click "Develop apps" → Create an app
3. Configure Admin API scopes
4. Install the app and copy the Admin API access token



## Variables

This collection includes pre-defined variables. You can set them in two ways:

**Option 1: Collection Variables (Quick Start)**
1. Click on the collection name
2. Go to the "Variables" tab
3. Fill in the "Current value" column

**Option 2: Environment Variables (Recommended for multiple stores)**
1. Import `Ecommerce_APIs.postman_environment.json`
2. Fill in your values
3. Select the environment in Postman

Environment variables override collection variables, so you can use both.

## Folders

| Folder | Description |
|--------|-------------|
| Products | Product CRUD operations |
| Variants | Variant management |
| Inventory | Inventory items and levels |
| Metafields | Product metafields |
| Collections | Smart and custom collections |
| Product Images | Image management |

## Additional Variables

| Variable | Used For |
|----------|----------|
| `shopify_product_id` | Product operations |
| `shopify_variant_id` | Variant operations |
| `shopify_inventory_item_id` | Inventory queries |
| `shopify_custom_collection_id` | Custom collection queries |
| `shopify_smart_collection_id` | Smart collection queries |

## API Documentation

https://shopify.dev/docs/api/admin-rest
